AclustsCCA 0.1.0

    • Step 3: Implement SparseCCA on each clusterg

    Summarize the A-clustering result

    summary.Aclustering.Rd

    Implement an iterative penalized least squares approach to sparse canonical correlation analysis (SparseCCA) with various penalty functions

    INPUT

    # S3 method for Aclustering
summary(clusters.list, annot, digits = 2)

    Arguments

    clusters.list

    : A list of clusters with CpG sites, each item is a cluster that contains a set of probes

    annot

    : A preloaded annotation file that includes columns the below name. For more information, https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/downloads/productfiles/methylationepic/infinium-methylationepic-manifest-column-headings.pdf.

    • IlmnID: The IlmnID

    • Coordinate_37: Chromosomal coordinates of the CpG

    • Islands_Name: Chromosomal coordinates of the CpG Island

    • Relation_to_Island: The location of the CpG relative to the CpG island

    • UCSC_RefGene_Name: Target gene name(s)

    digits

    : Show rounded values to the specified number of decimal places

    Value

    The function returns a table of summary characteristics:

    • Total number of sites used for the analysis

    • Number of singletons (a cluster with one CpG site)

    • Number of clusters (a cluster with at least two sites)

    • Number of CpG sites that are clustered

    • Number of CpG sites in cluster (min, median, max)

    • Base-pair distance between extremes (min, median, max)

    • (1) Clusters associated with a single refernece gene

    • (2) Clusters associated with a single CpG Island

    • (3-1) Clusters associated with a CpG resort : at least one resort regions

    • (3-2) Clusters associated with a CpG resort : at least two resort regions

    • (3-3) Clusters associated with a CpG resort : one resort regions

    • (3-4) Clusters associated with a CpG resort : two resort regions

    • (3-5) Clusters associated with a CpG resort : three resort regions

    Examples

    library("IlluminaHumanMethylation450kanno.ilmn12.hg19")

annot <- minfi::getAnnotation(IlluminaHumanMethylation450kanno.ilmn12.hg19)
annot <- data.table(data.frame(annot))
#> Error in data.table(data.frame(annot)): could not find function "data.table"
annot <- annot[!chr%in%c("chrY","chrX"),]
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'i' in selecting a method for function '[': error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function '%in%': object 'chr' not found
annot <- annot[,list("IlmnID"=Name,"Coordinate_37"=pos,"CHR"=as.numeric(gsub("chr", "", chr)),Islands_Name,Relation_to_Island,UCSC_RefGene_Name)]
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'j' in selecting a method for function '[': object 'Name' not found
annot <- annot[order(CHR,Coordinate_37),]
#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'i' in selecting a method for function '[': object 'CHR' not found

clusters.list <- assign.to.clusters(betas.7, annot)
#> Error in assign.to.clusters(betas.7, annot): could not find function "assign.to.clusters"
summary.Aclustering(clusters.list=clusters.list,annot=annot,digits=2)
#> Error in summary.Aclustering(clusters.list = clusters.list, annot = annot,     digits = 2): could not find function "summary.Aclustering"
